page.title: 01Introduction to 03440240
page.content: This block is mostly rural. Its main concentrations of population are in the small village of Stretton Sugwas, a small part of the larger village of Credenhill, and part of the urban development of Hereford City westwards along the main A438 road from Hereford to Brecon. Other houses are situated singly, such as farmsteads, or in small groups. The block is bisected east/west by the A438 road and includes in the SW corner a stretch of the River Wye, here running mainly N/S. The block is largely agricultural, with fertile soil formed from glacial deposits from the melting Wye glacier. Some of the land is owned by the Prudential Assurance Company and rented to various tenants.
